title: E-liter 4K Scope
content:
The E-liter 4K Scope is a main weapon in Splatoon 2 and Splatoon 3, and a successor to Splatoon's E-liter 3K Scope.

The E-liter 4K Scope is an E-liter 4K with a scope attached. Compared to the scopeless version it has enhanced range and a zoomed view for greater aiming precision, but players have their field of vision limited by the scope, and it can not store its charge in swim form. Besides this, all other stats are the same as the E-liter 4K, and it shares its sub and special weapons.

The E-liter 4K Scope is nearly identical in appearance to the E-liter 4K. The only difference between the two is that the E-liter 4K Scope has a scope attached to the gas pump handle and the back end of the barrel.

The E-liter 4K Scope comes with Ink Mines and Ink Storm.

It appears in three Octo Expansion stations:

- D02 One-Shot Station

- D05 All That 8-Ball Station

- G03 House Party Station

- The E-liter 4K Scope is a heavyweight weapon.

- The matchmaking range is 330. The game's matchmaking system looks at a team's average matchmaking range value, and matches them against a team with a similar average.

- Ink consumption scales from 2.25% to 25% depending on the charge level.
The full-charge ink consumption of 25% allows players to fire 4 shots before needing to refill the ink supply.
This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- ▲ Range when not fully charged is not reduced to match its unscoped variant.

- ▲ Fully-charged ink consumption: 30% → 25%.

- ▼ Movement speed while not charging or firing is reduced by 8.3%: 0.96 units/frame → 0.88 units/frame.

- ▲ Increased the amount of ink splattered by each shot when it hits the ground.

- ▲ Area at player's feet will now always be inked when firing.

- ▲ Increased damage dealt to the barrier around the Rainmaker by a fully-charged shot by roughly 15%: 2x → 2.3x.

- ▲ Increased the effect of the Main Power Up gear ability.

- ▲ The increase to shot range with the maximum number of Main Power Up gear abilities equipped has been raised from roughly 3% to roughly 5%.

- ▲ In addition to the existing effect, Main Power Up will now also improve ink coverage.

- ▲ Increased damage dealt to opponent Splat Brellas by 17%: 3x → 3.5x.

- ▲ Increased damage dealt to Bubble Blower by 23%: 1.3x → 1.6x.

- ▲ Increased damage dealt to opponent Booyah Bomb armor by 4%: 1.3x → 1.35x.

- ▲ Increased damage dealt to opponent Splash Walls by 10%: 2x → 2.2x.

- ▼ Very slightly narrowed the width of the area inked by a fully charged shot: 18.5 units → 17.7 units.

The E-liter 4K Scope delivers the long-range action of the 4K model with a scope for added accuracy! Though it boasts a shot range that beats almost every other charger, you'll want to be extra aware of your surroundings when scoping in. Also, the scoped configuration won't let you store a charged shot, so keep that in mind as you adjust to the feel of using a scope. Like the standard 4K, you'll get Ink Mines and the Ink Storm to help cover the battlefield while you zoom in and splat unsuspecting foes!

The E-liter 4K Scope delivers the long-range action of the 4K model with a scope for added accuracy! Though it boasts a shot range that beats almost every other charger, you'll want to be extra aware of your surroundings when scoping in. Unlike the E-liter 4K, the scoped configuration won't let you store a charged shot, so keep that in mind as you adjust to the feel of using a scope. It comes with the same Ink Mines and Wave Breaker special as the base E-liter 4K, so you can apply the same strategy—stay safe while you zoom in and splat unsuspecting foes!
